member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Word.Section.RtfHelper
member.summary: Writes text and RTF codes.
member.remarks:
This class implements IDisposable as it creates a collection of font objects that need disposed.
The c++ class used a CSource stream/memory manager thing to output to. I switched to StringBuilder. The only tricky thing about this change appears to be that CSource had this InsertBlock method that inserted data at speicifc postions in the output stream. It was used only to allow GenColorTable() to insert data into the middle of the stream in the header area.

member.name: T:DataDynamics.Diagnostics.InternalTracer
member.summary: Provides a common way to trace messages that do not show up easily to our users. Support personel or the developer can use the TraceSwitch in a config file (web.config for exe config) to turn tracing on and off.

member.name: F:DataDynamics.Diagnostics.InternalTracer.traceSwitchString
member.summary: Put this string in a config file under configuration\system.diagnostics\switches\add to turn on tracing. Then add a listenter under configuration\system.diagnostics\trace\listeners.

member.name: F:DataDynamics.Diagnostics.InternalTracer.tracingSwitch
member.summary: Used with this class's LogMessage method to indicate if tracing is turned on or not. I'm using guid strings to keep prying eyes from understanding what's going on, and an attempt ot prevent users from easily turning tracing on.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.Diagnostics.InternalTracer.Trace(System.String)
member.summary: Provides tracing when defined appropriately in an application configuration file.
member.param: The trace message to be written to a trace listener.
member.remarks: This could be used with support and an appropriate app.config file to implement tracing when output is messed up for unknown reasons. I've applied these debugger attributes to it to attempt to keep it out of call stacks and debuggers stepping though it. If this method is found to be a sevear performance hinderence (presumably via profiling), then we should be able to uncomment the ConditionalAttribute below and only have it included in DEBUG builds only.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.Diagnostics.InternalTracer.Trace(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Provides tracing with string.format like capabilities.

member.name: T:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.CanvasUtils
member.summary: Provides utility functions useful when parsing CanvasItem records in a Canvas/Page.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.CanvasUtils.AreBoundsClose(System.Drawing.RectangleF,System.Drawing.RectangleF)
member.summary: Returns true if the bounds are within 1000'th of an inch of each other.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.CanvasUtils.OutsideRect(System.Drawing.RectangleF,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns true if element is entirely outside rectangle. False if inside or intersecting.
member.returns: True if element is entirely outside rectangle, otherwise returns false.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.CanvasUtils.InsideRect(System.Drawing.RectangleF,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns true if the specified element is entirely inside the specified rectangle (or exactly the same bounds); false if outside or intersecting.
member.returns: True if the specified element is entirely inside the specified rectangle; false if outside or intersecting.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.CanvasUtils.ClipLine(System.Drawing.RectangleF,GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Document.Section.LineItem@,GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Document.Section.LineItem)
member.summary: This function takes a line and a clipping rectangle, and outputs a clipped line in the pNew argument.
member.param: The new, clipped line will be returned in this argument.
The old line you want clipped.
member.returns: Returns true when the line is entirely outside of the cliprect and therefore not renderable. If the line intersects the cliprect, then ClipLine(..) will generate a line that does fit entirely inside the cliprect and set it to pNew, and true will be returned. If the line is entirely inside the cliprect, then ClipLine simply sets pNew to pOld and returns false.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.CanvasUtils.IntersectLines(System.Drawing.PointF@,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns true if lines intersect, false if not, sets ppointout to point of intersection.
member.param: If lines intersect, this will be the point of intersection.
member.returns: True if lines intersect, false if not.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.CanvasUtils.ClipShapeBounds(System.Drawing.RectangleF@,System.Drawing.RectangleF)
member.summary: Clips the specified bounds for a shape based on the specified clipRect.
member.param: The bounds for the item. Upon return of this function this value will have the clipped bounds.
The clipping rectangle according to which itemBounds will be clipped.
member.returns: True if the item should be rendered according to the new bounds, or false if the item should not be rendered at all.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.CanvasUtils.ClipImage(System.Drawing.Image@,System.Drawing.RectangleF@,System.Drawing.RectangleF)
member.summary: Clips the specified image if necessary.
member.returns: True if you should render the specified image. Note that the location and actual image arguments may have been changed by this function. False, indicates that you should not render the specified image due to the cliprect. This would normally indicate that the image is entirely outside of the cliprect.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.CanvasUtils.MeasureString(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.String,System.Drawing.Font,System.Drawing.SizeF,System.Drawing.StringFormat,System.Single,GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PaddingEx,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Single)
member.summary: RS: CR 23121 - String measurer that takes into account the character spacing

member.name: T:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.ExportContext
member.summary: This class is basically the same as RenderContext in ActiveReports, but customized for contextual information specific to Exports and not a Graphics. Much of the functionality is exactly the same as RenderContext. However, RenderContext is tightly coupled with each of the CanvasItem's and uses CanvasItem.Render to maintain/update RenderContext, which also does rendering to a Grahpics, which is inappropriate and inefficient for Excel or any Export filter.
member.remarks: Differences between ExportContext and RenderContext: - The current cliprect is manged by ExportContext here, not Graphics like RenderContext. - The ClipStack is a stack of RectangleF structs, and not System.Drawing.Drawing2D.Region. All our clips are rectangles in RDF and I think regions were only used in RenderContext because that's what Graphics uses and rendercontext stores it's "current cliprect" on the Grahpics, not RenderContext.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.ExportContext.#ctor(GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Document.Section.Document.Filters.IFilteredPage)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the ExportContext.
member.param: The DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Page object that this context is relative to. All fonts (see ) are slected from the Page's Fonts collection.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.ExportContext.GetDefaultFontWithPointUnit
member.summary: Clone font for azure while sizeinpoints throw outofmemory exception.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.ExportContext.PushClipRect
member.summary: Takes the current clipRect (in CurrentClipRect property) and pushes it onto the ClipStack. The current cliprect is still maintained as the "current cliprect".

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.ExportContext.PopClipRect
member.summary: Takes the last cliprect put onto the stack and sets it as the current cliprect. If there are no cliprects on the stack then the current cliprect is cleared, and IsClipActive is set to false.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.ExportContext.IntersectClipRect(System.Drawing.RectangleF)
member.summary: Uses member method RectangleF.Intersect on the currentCliprect to calculate the intersecting clipping rectangle and sets that resulting clip rect as the current clip rect available via the ClipRect property.
